moves.1. e4 d6 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nc3 g6 4. Bc4 Bg7: A Pirc defence with d3 rather than d4. Black could have been more ambitious by playing c5 or e5.
moves.11. Bxe6 fxe6 12. Nxe6 Qe7 13. Nxf8 Nxf8: White has two pawns and a rook for the bishop and knight. Black retakes with the knight - it can now reach the inviting d4 square via e6.
moves.14. Bg5 Ne6 15. Qd2 Bd7: Black chooses not to swap knight for bishop, and instead continues with development.
moves.16. Rfe1 Nd4: Black is not worried about the pinned knight on f6.
moves.17. Ne2 Qe5 18. Nxd4 Qxd4: White decides to swap knights on d4, and can now play c3.
moves.19. c3 Qa7: The black queen is relegated to a less active square.
moves.20. Qf4 Rf8 21. Qe3: White decides against snatching the pawn on d6 - black has a potentially nasty discovered attack on f2 when he moves the knight.
moves.21... Qb8: Black is down material and doesn't want to swap queens.
moves.22. d4: White's plan is to make the most of his rooks by opening a file.
moves.22... Be6 23. Bh6: White wants to deprive Black of the bishop pair, so decides to swap dark-square bishops.
moves.23... Nh5 24. Bxg7 Kxg7 25. e5 d5: Black keeps the centre closed at the cost of cutting off his bishop's queenside activity -  in any case the bishop will be stuck blockading the passed e-pawn.
moves.26. g4 Nf4: Black's knight obtains an outpost on f4.
moves.27. Kh2 Qd8: Black's queen is looking a little more lively.
moves.29. a4 b4 30. cxb4 axb4 31. a5: White succeeds in creating a passed pawn on the queenside.
moves.31... h5: Black must get on with his attack.
moves.32. f3 hxg4 33. fxg4 Rh8: An advantage of the queen on g5 is that the rook is not tied to maintaining the knight outpost. Now the pawn on g4 looks wobbily.
moves.34... Bxg4: Much thought was put into this move. Black decides that it is safe to capture on g4.
moves.35. Rag1: White doubles up on the g-file, putting more pressure on the pinned bishop.
moves.35... Nxh3: h3 falls, but at the cost of allowing white to exchange queens.
moves.36. Qxg5: After the queens are off, white will hope to bring home one of the passed pawns.
moves.36... Nf4+:
Oh. White resigns.

 Thanks for reading, hope you enjoyed the game!
